question: ਅੰਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੀ ਹੋਇਆ?
answer: ਕੋਮਾ ਵਿੱਚ ਜਾਣ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਉਸ ਆਦਮੀ ਨੂੰ ਹੌਲੀ-ਹੌਲੀ ਦਿਮਾਗ਼ੀ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ ਹੋਇਆ ਅਤੇ 23 ਨਵੰਬਰ ਨੂੰ ਉਸ ਦੀ ਮੌਤ ਹੋ ਗਈ।

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: ਕੀ ਤੈਨੂੰ ਸੱਚੀਂ ਏਨਾ ਦਰਦ ਮਹਿਸੂਸ ਹੋਇਆ ਜਦੋਂ ਮਰੀਜ਼ ਜ਼ੋਰ ਨਾਲ ਚੀਕਿਆ?
answer: ਖਾਸ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ, ਤੁਹਾਡਾ ਖ਼ਤਰਾ ਵੱਧ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ ਜੇ: 1. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਸੋਜਸ਼ ਵਾਲੀ ਅੰਤੜੀ ਦੀ ਬਿਮਾਰੀ ਹੈ, 2. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਸੋਜਸ਼ ਵਾਲਾ ਦਮਾ ਹੈ, 3. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਸੱਜੇ ਪਾਸੇ ਪਹਿਲੀ ਡਿਗਰੀ ਦਾ ਵੇਨਸ ਥ੍ਰੋਮੋਬਸਿਸ ਹੈ, 4. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਸੂਡੋਮੈਂਬਰੇਨ ਕੋਲਾਈਟਿਸ ਹੈ, ਅਤੇ 5. ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਐਡਰੀਨਲ ਘਾਟ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਸੈਪਸਿਸ ਹੈ।

question: ਕੀ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਸੈਪਟਾ ਤੋਂ ਐਂਟੀਬਾਇਓਟਿਕਸ ਲੈਣ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ ਇੱਕ 'ਸਾਈਬਰ' ਮਾਨਸਿਕ ਖੂਨ ਵਹਿਣ ਦੀ ਲਾਗ ਲਈ ਸੈਪਟਾਸਿਡ ਲੈ ਰਹੇ ਹੋ। ਇਲਾਜ 7-10 ਦਿਨਾਂ ਤੱਕ ਚੱਲੇਗਾ।

The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: ਮੈਂ ਸੋਚਦਾ ਹਾਂ ਕਿ ਪਨੀਰ ਤੋਂ ਕਿਸ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਦੀਆਂ ਦਵਾਈਆਂ ਬਣਾਈਆਂ ਜਾਂਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ।
answer: ਅਗਲੀ ਮੁਲਾਕਾਤ ਤੱਕ ਮੌਜੂਦਾ ਐਂਟੀਡਿਪ੍ਰੈਸੈਂਟ ਦਵਾਈਆਂ ਲੈਂਦੇ ਰਹੋ। ਸੂਚੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੇਠ ਲਿਖੀਆਂ ਦਵਾਈਆਂ ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਹਨ: ਫੇਨੀਟੋਰਿਨ, ਫੇਨੀਥੋਬਾਰਬੀਟਲ, ਟੋਪੀਰਾਮੇਟ, ਕਲੋਬੇਨਜ਼ੀਨ, ਅਤੇ ਲੇਮੋਟ੍ਰਿਜੀਨ।

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. question: ਰਿਬੋਫਲੇਵਿਨ 6 ਮਹੀਨਿਆਂ ਲਈ ਕਿਉਂ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਜਾਂਦੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਇਹ 'ਗੋਥਿਕ ਥ੍ਰੋਮੋਬੋਸਿਸ' (ਖ਼ੂਨ ਦੇ ਜੰਮਣ) ਲਈ ਪਰਚੀ ਹੈ ਜੋ ਤੁਸੀਂ 'ਸਾਜਨ ਖੀਨ' ਵਿੱਚ ਵੇਖੀ ਸੀ। ਪਰਚੀ ਹੈ 'ਰੇਕਸੋਬਨ 20 ਮਿਲੀਗ੍ਰਾਮ/ਦਿਨ... 6 ਮਹੀਨਿਆਂ ਲਈ'।

question: ਕੀ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਆਪਣੀ ਪਤਨੀ ਨੂੰ ਫਿਜ਼ੀਓਥੈਰੇਪਿਸਟ ਕੋਲ ਲੈ ਜਾਣਾ ਚਾਹੀਦਾ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਕਮਰੇ ਨੂੰ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ ਧਿਆਨ ਦੇਣ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ ਕਿਉਂਕਿ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਕਾਰ ਫਿਜ਼ੀਓਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਸੈਸ਼ਨ ਦੌਰਾਨ ਇਸਨੂੰ ਤੋੜ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਸੀ।

question: ਖੁਰਕ ਦਾ ਇਲਾਜ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਅਸੀਂ ਪੜ੍ਹਿਆ ਕਿ "ਤੂਰੀ ਦਾ ਇਲਾਜ 17 ਅਪ੍ਰੈਲ ਨੂੰ ਆਈਵਰਮੈਕਟਿਨ ਨਾਲ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ, ਅਤੇ 7 ਦਿਨਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਦੁਬਾਰਾ ਇਲਾਜ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾਵੇਗਾ" (ਸੁੰਦਰ ਕਿਤਾਬ ਤੋਂ)।

However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceBptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. question: ਮੇਰੀ ਖੋਪੜੀ ਦੀ ਸਕੈਨਿੰਗ (ਈਈਜੀ) ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਹੈ ਜਾਂ ਨਹੀਂ?
answer: The EEG on 19/12 showed "acute progressive encephalopathy", whereas the EEG on 22/12 showed "much improvement compared with earlier tracing".

question: ਹੇ, ਕੀ ਮੇਰਾ ਸੀ.ਟੀ. ਸਕੈਨ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ?
answer: ਖੋਪੜੀ ਦੀ ਕੰਪਿਊਟਿਡ ਟੋਮੋਗ੍ਰਾਫੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੋਈ ਮਹੱਤਵਪੂਰਨ ਬਦਲਾਅ ਨਹੀਂ ਮਿਲਿਆ। ਹੱਡੀ ਦੀ ਕੰਪਿਊਟਿਡ ਟੋਮੋਗ੍ਰਾਫੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੋਈ ਬਿਮਾਰੀ ਨਹੀਂ ਮਿਲੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਕੋਲ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਭਰਾ ਦੇ ਸੱਭਿਆਚਾਰ ਬਾਰੇ ਕੋਈ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ?
answer: 19/12 ਤੋਂ, ਇਹ ਖੂਨ ਦੇ ਟੈਸਟਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਇਹ ਸਟੈਫ਼ੀਲੋਕੋਕਸ ਔਰੀਅਸ ਕਰਕੇ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ। 16/01 ਤੋਂ, ਇਹ ਖੂਨ ਦੇ ਟੈਸਟਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਇਹ ਸੂਡੋਮੋਨਾਸ ਏਰੂਗਿਨੋਸਾ ਕਰਕੇ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ।

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: Do I need to be taken to the hospital?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ "ਬੁਖਾਰ ਵਾਲੀ ਨਬਜ਼, ਠੰਡਾ ਪਸੀਨਾ, ਅਤੇ ਆਮ ਥਕਾਵਟ" ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਡੇ "ਮਾੜੇ ਵਾਈਟਲ ਸਾਈਨ, ਘੱਟ ਬਲੱਡ ਕਾਊਂਟ, ਅਤੇ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਦੀ ਕੋਈ ਕੋਸ਼ਿਸ਼ ਨਹੀਂ" ਸੀ।

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: ਮਰਦਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਪੇਟ ਦਰਦ ਨੂੰ ਰੋਕਣ ਲਈ ਕਿਹੜੇ ਉਪਾਅ ਕਰਨੇ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਹਨ?
answer: ਉਸ ਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਸਾਹ ਯੰਤਰ ਉੱਤੇ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਅਤੇ ਉਸ ਨੂੰ "ਵੈਂਟੀਲੇਟਰ" ਅਤੇ "ਟੀਵੀਐਸ ਪੈਰੀਸੀਅਰ" ਦਿੱਤਾ ਗਿਆ।

question: ਹੇ, ਤੂੰ ਐਂਟੀਬਾਇਓਟਿਕਸ ਤੋਂ ਇੰਨਾ ਡਰ ਕਿਉਂ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈਂ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 6 ਮਾਰਚ ਨੂੰ ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਹੋਏ ਇਨਫੈਕਸ਼ਨ ਲਈ ਸੇਫਟ੍ਰਾਈਐਕਸੋਨ, ਕਲਿੰਡਾਮਾਈਸਿਨ ਅਤੇ ਕਲੈਰੀਥਰੋਮਾਈਸਿਨ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ। 5 ਮਾਰਚ ਨੂੰ, ਇਸਨੂੰ ਪਾਈਪੇਰਾਕਸਿਲਿਨ, ਟ੍ਰੇਬਲੇਟੋਕਸਿਨ ਅਤੇ ਵੈਨਕੋਮਾਈਸਿਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਬਦਲ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

question: ਇਹ ਮੇਰੀ ਸੱਭਿਆਚਾਰ ਨਾਲ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਸਬੰਧਤ ਹੈ?

question: ਕੌਸਲਿਆ ਨੂੰ ਵੇਖਦਿਆਂ ਹੀ ਉਸ ਦੇ ਚਿਹਰੇ ਤੋਂ ਹੰਝੂ ਵਹਿ ਰਹੇ ਸਨ।
answer: ਉਸ ਦੀ ਹਾਲਤ ਸਥਿਰ ਦੱਸੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ ਪਰ ਸ਼ਾਮ 6:07 ਵਜੇ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਵਾਲੀ ਟਿਊਬ ਨਾਲ।

question: ਕੀ 'ਭਾਸਾ' ਦਵਾਈ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਮੰਨੀ ਜਾਂਦੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਖੂਨ ਦੀ ਮਾਤਰਾ ਘੱਟ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਲਈ, ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 5/6 ਦਿਨਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮਾ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ, ਅਤੇ ਇਲਾਜ 4/6 ਦਿਨਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਅਸਫਲ ਰਿਹਾ।

question: ਡਿਸਚਾਰਜ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਕੀ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਬਾਂਝਪਨ ਦੇ ਲੱਛਣ ਨਹੀਂ ਦੇਖਣੇ ਚਾਹੀਦੇ ਸਨ?
answer: He noted her "extreme sensitivity and delicacy", and her "profound self-control, her pauses, her pauses, her pauses, her pauses, her pauses", and her "sustained laughter".

question: ਕੀ ਮੇਰੀ ਦੂਜੀ ਯੋਜਨਾ ਵੀ ਚੰਗੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਪ੍ਰਾਇਮਰੀ ਕੇਅਰ ਪ੍ਰੋਵਾਈਡਰ ਅਤੇ ਨਵੀਂ ਲੀਵਰ ਟੋਮੋਗ੍ਰਾਫੀ ਲਈ ਫਾਲੋ-ਅੱਪ ਸਹੂਲਤ ਨਾਲ ਮੁਲਾਕਾਤ ਦਾ ਸਮਾਂ ਨਿਯਤ ਕਰ ਸਕਦੇ ਹੋ।

While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward and, from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: ਮੈਨੂੰ ਕਿਸੇ ਕਾਰਨ ਕਰਕੇ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਜਾਣਾ ਪਿਆ।
answer: ਇਸ ਦਾ ਕਾਰਨ ਬੈਕਟੀਰੀਆ ਅਤੇ ਫੰਗਲ ਐਂਡੋਕਾਰਡਾਈਟਿਸ (ਦਿਲ ਦੀ ਇਨਫੈਕਸ਼ਨ) ਹੈ। ਤੁਹਾਡਾ 'ਕੀਮੋਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਪਾਈਲੋਨੇਫ੍ਰਾਈਟਿਸ (ਪਿਸ਼ਾਬ ਨਾਲੀ ਦੀ ਇਨਫੈਕਸ਼ਨ)' ਦਾ ਇਲਾਜ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ।

question: ਕੀ ਸਾਡੀ ਮਾਂ ਦੀ ਪਰੰਪਰਾ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੋਈ ਬਿਮਾਰੀ ਪਾਈ ਗਈ ਹੈ?
answer: 'ਸਟੈਫ਼ੀਲੋਕੋਕਸ ਔਰੀਅਸ' (ਇੱਕ ਬੈਕਟੀਰੀਆ) 'ਟਾਈਮ 10/04' 'ਤੇ ਪਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। 'ਕੈਂਡੀਡਾ ਟ੍ਰੋਪੀਕਲਿਸ' (ਇੱਕ ਫੰਗਸ) 'ਟਾਈਮ 10/08' 'ਤੇ ਪਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

question: 19 ਅਕਤੂਬਰ ਨੂੰ ਕੀਤੇ ਗਏ ਕਾਰਲ ਮਾਰਕਸ ਐਕਸਪੈਂਸ਼ਨ (ਈਕੋਕਾਰਡੀਓਗ੍ਰਾਮ) ਦਾ ਨਤੀਜਾ ਕੀ ਸੀ?
answer: On October 19, mitral valve prolapse was observed in echocardiography in transesophageal echocardiography, which indicates infection (filament imaging), which increases the likelihood of diagnosis of endocarditis caused by bacteria and fungi.

question: ਮੈਂ 5 ਅਕਤੂਬਰ ਨੂੰ ਚੈੱਕ ਲਿਖਦੇ ਸਮੇਂ ਘਬਰਾਇਆ ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ।
answer: ਉਸ ਨੂੰ 10 ਮਈ ਨੂੰ ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮੇ ਅਤੇ ਡੀਹਾਈਡਰੇਸ਼ਨ ਲਈ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਾਖਲ ਕਰਵਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ 12 ਮਈ ਤੱਕ ਇੰਟੈਂਸਿਵ ਕੇਅਰ ਵਿੱਚ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward, and from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: ਮੈਨੂੰ ਇਲਾਜ ਲਈ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਜਾਣਾ ਪਵੇਗਾ।
answer: ਮੈਕਫੈਡਨ, ਜੋ ਆਖਰੀ ਵਾਰ 11 ਮਈ, 2021 ਨੂੰ ਸਵੇਰੇ 11:21 ਵਜੇ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦੇਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ, ਨੂੰ ਰੋਜ਼ਾਨਾ 100 ਮਿਲੀਗ੍ਰਾਮ ਆਈ.ਐੱਮ.ਜੀ. ਨਾੜੀ ਰਾਹੀਂ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ, ਜੋ ਕਿ ਫਾਲੋ-ਅਪ ਦੌਰਾਨ ਰੋਜ਼ਾਨਾ ਬੰਦ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਮੈਂ ਨਵੀਂ ਦਵਾਈ ਖਾਵਾਂ?
answer: ਡਾਕਟਰਾਂ ਨੇ ਸੇਲੀਨਾ ਨੂੰ ਦੁਬਾਰਾ ਪਾਣੀ ਪੀਣ ਦੀ ਸਲਾਹ ਦਿੱਤੀ, ਅਤੇ 6 ਹਫ਼ਤਿਆਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਮਸਤੇਨੀਆ ਗ੍ਰਿਲਾ ਨੇ ਪੀਣਾ ਬੰਦ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ।

question: ਕੀ ਇੱਕ ਹੋਰ ਦਿਲ ਦੀ ਜਾਂਚ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਮੈਨੂੰ 24 ਤਰੀਕ ਨੂੰ ਟ੍ਰਾਂਸਫੋਰਲ ਈਓਕਾਰਿਸਿਅਮ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਬਦੀਲ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਜਾਵੇਗਾ। 6 ਹਫ਼ਤਿਆਂ ਦਾ ਫਿੰਗਰ ਟ੍ਰੀਟਮੈਂਟ ਪੂਰਾ ਕਰਨ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਮੈਂ ਇੱਕ ਹੋਰ ਈਓਕਾਰਿਸਿਅਮ ਕਰਵਾਉਣ ਦੀ ਯੋਜਨਾ ਬਣਾ ਰਿਹਾ ਹਾਂ।

question: ਮੇਰਾ ਕੈਂਸਰ (ਮਲਟੀਪਲ ਮਾਈਲੋਮਾ) ਇਲਾਜ ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਇਲਾਜ ਦੇ ਸ਼ਡਿਊਲ ਅਤੇ ਆਉਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਸੈਸ਼ਨਾਂ ਬਾਰੇ, [ਸੰਸਥਾ] ਨੇ [ਮਰਦ ਦਾ ਨਾਮ] ਨਾਲ [ਮਿਤੀ] 11/08/2020 ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਮੀਟਿੰਗ ਤੈਅ ਕੀਤੀ ਹੈ।

While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward, and from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: 31 ਅਕਤੂਬਰ ਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ, ਅਤੇ ਮੈਂ ਬਹੁਤ ਖੁਸ਼ ਹਾਂ।
answer: 31 ਅਕਤੂਬਰ ਨੂੰ, ਸਾਨੂੰ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਸਰੀਰ 'ਤੇ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਇੱਕ ਲਾਲ ਧੱਬਾ ਮਿਲਿਆ। ਇਸਨੂੰ 'ਡਰੈੱਸ ਸਿੰਡਰੋਮ' ਮੰਨਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ, ਪਰ ਉਹ ਲਾਲ ਧੱਬਾ ਪੂਰੀ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਗਾਇਬ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ, ਅਤੇ ਈਓਸਿਨੋਫਿਲ ਗਿਣਤੀ ਘੱਟ ਗਈ। ਇਸ ਲਈ, ਕਿਉਂਕਿ ਕਲੀਨਿਕਲ ਸ਼ੱਕ ਘੱਟ ਸੀ, ਅਸੀਂ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਮੌਕਾ ਦੇਣ ਦਾ ਫੈਸਲਾ ਕੀਤਾ।

question: ਮੇਰਾ ਮਲਟੀਪਲ ਮਾਈਲੋਮਾ ਕਿਵੇਂ ਵੱਧ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ? ਹਾਲ ਹੀ ਦੇ ਸੀਟੀ ਸਕੈਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੀ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ?
answer: 18 ਅਕਤੂਬਰ ਨੂੰ, ਟੋਮੋਗ੍ਰਾਫੀ ਨੇ ਬੋਨ ਮੈਰੋ ਅਤੇ ਪਲਮਨਰੀ ਪੈਰੇਨਕਾਈਮਾ ਦੀ "ਮਲਟੀਪਲ ਮਾਈਲੋਮਾ ਸ਼ਮੂਲੀਅਤ" ਅਤੇ "ਕੋਰਡ ਸ਼ਮੂਲੀਅਤ" ਦਾ ਖੁਲਾਸਾ ਕੀਤਾ।

question: ਤੂੰ ਕਿੱਥੇ ਸੀ ਜਦੋਂ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਸਤੰਬਰ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਟ੍ਰੋਕ ਆਇਆ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਾਖਲ ਕਰਵਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ? ਕੀ ਤੂੰ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਡੁਬੋ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਸੀ?
answer: ਸਤੰਬਰ 2024 ਵਿੱਚ, ਉਹ ਇੱਕ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਪਲਮਨਰੀ ਐਂਬੋਲਿਜ਼ਮ (ਖੂਨ ਦੀਆਂ ਨਾੜੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਰੁਕਾਵਟ) ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਸੀ, ਜਿਸ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਗੈਰ-ਹਮਲਾਵਰ ਹਵਾਦਾਰੀ 'ਤੇ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

discharge_summary: 1 peripheral arterial obstructive disease critical ischemia / oaa? postoperative 11/08 suprapatellar amputation of the right lower limb in emergency 2 septic shock of cutaneous focus infectious signs, necrosis in the right lower limb current antibiotic therapy: tazocin 11/14 vancomycin 11/19 previous: vancomycin 11/08 cefepime d0 11/08 11/11 ceftriaxone 11/11 11/14 oxacillin d0 11/09 11/14 3 stable multifocal atrial tachycardia circumstantial using amiodarone for rate control and for nsv on 11/27 4 acute kidney injury kdigo 3: secondary to sepsis? rhabdomyolysis? prerenal? in renal replacement therapy 11/13 5 decreased level of consciousness due to uremia and worsening of infection 11/13 maintaining floating Glasgow coma scale 7-9 in the context of post-extubation orotracheal reintubation on 11/13, antibiotic therapy escalated to tazocin vancomycin, dialysis support started. 6 pseudomembranous colitis, voluminous diarrhea unresponsive to dietary adjustment, previous use of broad-spectrum antibiotic therapy, including tazocin absence of toxin a/b test in the service, treatment being started due to clinical/epidemiological characteristics oral metronidazole on 11/29. 7 surgical wound infection extensive necrosis and dehiscence of surgical stump. 8 hospital pneumonia? new image on chest x-ray on 12/04, with increased secretion aspiration and decreased level of consciousness measures started to reduce secretion. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 28 d 04 h, location: ward payer: SUS. 14 days ago, he started to have a blackened appearance and lesions on his right lower limb. until then he was walking. associated with pain without improvement with analgesics, but he did not seek [person]. 2 days ago, he presented a bad smell, lesions on his right lower limb and a fall from his own height in the bathroom, without traumatic brain injury, without loss of consciousness, at which time he sought [person] on 11/06, since then awaiting transfer as an inpatient. he reports that he was agitated and contactful upon admission at the origin, but after medication he became more drowsy. hu: concentrated diuresis in an indwelling urinary catheter. hi: companion was unable to provide information. upon admission, he was hemodynamically stable, without vasoactive drugs. oxygen saturation 100% room air. respiratory rate 24, heart rate 60, blood pressure 110x60, temperature 37.3. drowsy, barely contacting glasgow 13 at 3 / rv 4 / rm 6. with passive warming of the right lower limb. [person] died on {omitted} at {omitted}. absent pulses, unresponsive with mydriatic pupils, cold extremities, with inaudible heart sounds. death.
question: Were you taken to the hospital?
answer: ਦੋ ਦਿਨ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ, "ਇੱਕ ਕਾਲੀ ਤਸਵੀਰ ਅਤੇ ਚਿਹਰੇ 'ਤੇ ਇੱਕ ਜ਼ਖ਼ਮ" ਬ੍ਰਾਜ਼ੀਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਪਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਦੋ ਦਿਨ ਬਾਅਦ, "ਇੱਕ ਬਦਬੂਦਾਰ, ਸੱਜੇ ਪਾਸੇ ਇੱਕ ਜ਼ਖ਼ਮ, ਅਤੇ ਉਹ ਡਿੱਗ ਪਿਆ।"

question: Hey, is my creatinine level abnormal? Is dialysis required?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਗੁਰਦੇ ਦੀ ਪੁਰਾਣੀ ਬਿਮਾਰੀ ਸੀਕੇਡੀ-3' (ਜਿਸਨੂੰ ਦੂਜੀ ਵਾਰ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਸੈਪਸਿਸ ਮੰਨਿਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ) ਦਾ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗਾ ਹੈ। ਤੁਸੀਂ 11 ਤੋਂ 13 ਤੱਕ 'ਗੁਰਦੇ ਬਦਲਣ ਦਾ ਇਲਾਜ' (ਡਾਇਲਸਿਸ) ਕਰਵਾ ਰਹੇ ਸੀ।

question: ਤੁਸੀਂ ਕਿੰਨਾ ਸੌਂਦੇ ਹੋ, ਅਤੇ ਕਿੰਨੀ ਦੇਰ ਤੱਕ ਜਾਗਦੇ ਰਹਿੰਦੇ ਹੋ?
answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ ਯੂਰੀਮੀਆ ਅਤੇ ਇਨਫੈਕਸ਼ਨ ਤੋਂ ਬਚਣ ਦੀ ਕੋਸ਼ਿਸ਼ ਕਰ ਰਹੇ ਸੀ। ਜਦੋਂ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਪਹੁੰਚੇ ਤਾਂ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਬੇਹੋਸ਼ੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਸੀ।

question: ਮੇਰਾ ਢਿੱਡ ਕੜਵੱਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ। ਮੈਨੂੰ ਫੁੱਲਿਆ ਹੋਇਆ ਮਹਿਸੂਸ ਹੋ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ।

answer: ਉਸ ਆਦਮੀ ਨੇ ਆਪਣੀ ਲੱਤ, ਗੁਰਦਾ ਅਤੇ ਹੋਰ ਅੰਗ ਗੁਆ ਦਿੱਤੇ ਅਤੇ ਆਖਰਕਾਰ ਉਸ ਦੀ ਮੌਤ ਹੋ ਗਈ।

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. question: ਕੈਟਿਨ, ਮੇਰੀ ਸਰਜਰੀ 2010/1 ਲਈ ਕਦੋਂ ਤੈਅ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੀ ਖੋਜ ਨਾਲ ਇੱਕ ਮੈਚ ਮਿਲਿਆ, ਅਤੇ ਡਾਕਟਰਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਅੰਤੜੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਇੱਕ ਛੇਕ ਮਿਲਿਆ। ਉਸਨੇ ਪਰਫੋਰੇਟਿੰਗ ਸਰਜਰੀ ਅਤੇ ਪੈਰੀਟੋਨਿਓਸਟੋਮੀ ਕੀਤੀ।

answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਆਖਰੀ ਵਾਰ 9 ਜੂਨ ਨੂੰ ਆਪਰੇਸ਼ਨ ਅਤੇ ਐਂਡੋਸਕੋਪੀ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਫਾਲੋ-ਅਪ ਅਤੇ ਰੱਖ-ਰਖਾਅ ਲਈ ਬੁਲਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਸਾਡੀਆਂ ਅੰਤੜੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਿਸੇ ਕਿਸਮ ਦੀ ਕੋਈ ਸਮੱਸਿਆ ਹੈ?
answer: ਉਸ ਨੇ 9 ਜੁਲਾਈ 2010 ਨੂੰ ਕਿਹਾ ਕਿ "ਪੂਰਵ-ਅਨੁਮਾਨ ਬਹੁਤ ਵਧੀਆ ਲੱਗਦਾ ਹੈ।" 9 ਅਗਸਤ 2010 ਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਸੀਟੀ ਸਕੈਨ ਨੇ "ਪਲੇਵੋਲੈਕਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਇੱਕ ਹਲਕਾ ਪਲਮਨਰੀ ਐਂਬੋਲਿਜ਼ਮ" ਦਿਖਾਇਆ।

answer: ਲੰਬੇ ਸਮੇਂ ਤੱਕ ਮਕੈਨੀਕਲ ਵੈਂਟੀਲੇਸ਼ਨ ਦੇ ਕਾਰਨ, ਟ੍ਰੈਕਿਓਸਟੋਮੀ ਦੀ ਸਿਫਾਰਸ਼ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਫ਼ਸਲ ਸਿਰਫ਼ 15 ਸਤੰਬਰ ਤੋਂ ਹੀ ਆ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ?
answer: 15 ਨਵੰਬਰ ਨੂੰ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਲੰਬਾ ਚੁੰਮਣ ਮਿਲਿਆ ਅਤੇ ਫਿਰ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਮੁੜ ਸੁਰਜੀਤ ਕਰਨਾ ਪਿਆ (ਉਸ ਨੂੰ ਦਿਲ ਦਾ ਦੌਰਾ ਪਿਆ)।

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਲੱਗਦਾ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਜਾਣ ਦੀ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤ ਪਵੇਗੀ?
answer: ਅਧਿਕਾਰਤ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਇਹ ਸਿੱਟਾ ਕੱਢਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ "ਕੁੱਝ ਗਲਤ ਖੇਡ" ਹੋਈ ਸੀ ਪਰ "ਪੋਸਟਮਾਰਟਮ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਪੁਸ਼ਟੀ ਕਰਦੀ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਉਸ ਦੀ ਮੌਤ ਕੁਦਰਤੀ ਕਾਰਨਾਂ ਕਰਕੇ ਹੋਈ ਸੀ"।

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: Am I going to the hospital?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਤੁਹਾਡੀਆਂ ਅੱਖਾਂ ਸੰਬੰਧੀ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੀਆਂ ਪੇਚੀਦਗੀਆਂ ਸਨ।' ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਤੁਹਾਡੀਆਂ ਅੱਖਾਂ ਸੰਬੰਧੀ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਦੀਆਂ ਪੇਚੀਦਗੀਆਂ ਸਨ,' ਅਤੇ 'ਕਮਰੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਆਕਸੀਜਨ ਦਾ ਪੱਧਰ 88% ਸੀ, ਹੌਲੀ-ਹੌਲੀ ਘੱਟ ਰਿਹਾ ਸੀ।'

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਜੇਬ ਕਤਰੇ ਲਈ ਲਾਈਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੋ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 2017/1 ਵਿੱਚ 'ਐਂਡੋਟ੍ਰੈਕੀਅਲ ਇੰਟਿਊਬੇਸ਼ਨ' ਲਈ ਦਾਖਲ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 2017/29 ਵਿੱਚ ਟ੍ਰੈਕਿਓਸਟੋਮੀ ਹੋਈ ਸੀ।

question: ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮਾ ਕੀ ਹੈ? ਇਹ ਉਦੋਂ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ ਜਦੋਂ ਕਿਸੇ ਨੂੰ ਦੋ ਲਾਗਾਂ ਹੁੰਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ।
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 14/01 ਨੂੰ ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮਾ ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 24/01 ਨੂੰ ਇੱਕ ਨਵਾਂ ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮਾ ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ, ਇਸ ਲਈ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਸੀਦਾ ਮੈਡੀਸਨ' ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਕਰ ਦੇਣੀ ਚਾਹੀਦੀ ਸੀ।

question: ਮੇਰੇ ਸਿਰ 'ਤੇ ਇਹ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਲਾਗ ਇਸ ਲਈ ਲੱਗੀ ਕਿਉਂਕਿ ਤੁਹਾਡਾ ਇਲਾਜ ਕੋਰਟੀਕੋਸਟੀਰੋਇਡਜ਼ ਨਾਲ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

question: 'ਨੋਮਾਡਿਸਟ' ਸ਼ਬਦ ਦਾ ਕੀ ਅਰਥ ਹੈ?
answer: 26 ਜਨਵਰੀ ਨੂੰ, ਉਸ ਦਾ ਇੱਕ ਜੰਗਲੀ ਜਾਨਵਰਾਂ ਦੇ ਝੁੰਡ ਨੇ ਪਿੱਛਾ ਕੀਤਾ; ਵਾਟਰਹੋਲ ਭਰਨ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਜੰਗਲੀ ਜਾਨਵਰਾਂ ਨੇ ਭੱਜ ਕੇ ਉਸ ਨੂੰ ਮਾਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ।

question: Do I need to have a tracheostomy?
answer: ਉਹ 'ਫਾਈਬਰੋਸਕੋਪ' 'ਤੇ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਕੋਈ ਲੱਛਣ ਨਹੀਂ ਸਨ। ਉਸਦਾ 3 ਮਾਰਚ 2010 ਨੂੰ ਡੀਕੈਨੁਲਾਈਜ਼ੇਸ਼ਨ (ਟਿਊਬ ਹਟਾਉਣਾ) ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ। ਛੁੱਟੀ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਉਹ ਡਰੇਨੇਜ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ 'ਟ੍ਰੈਕਿਓਸਟੋਮੀ' 'ਤੇ ਸੀ।

question: Can we go alone?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡਾ 2 ਅਤੇ 3 ਫਰਵਰੀ, 2010 ਨੂੰ ਸਪੀਚ ਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਦਾ ਚੈਕਅੱਪ ਸੀ, ਅਤੇ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਨਰਮ ਭੋਜਨ ਖਾਣਾ ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਛੋਟ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ, ਅਤੇ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਨਰਮ ਭੋਜਨ ਖਾ ਰਹੇ ਸੀ।

He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: ਕੈਟਿਨ, ਕੀ ਮੇਰਾ ਕੰਨ ਦਾ ਦਰਦ ਠੀਕ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ 'ਚੰਗੀ, ਆਮ' ਹਾਲਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੋ। ਤੁਹਾਡੀ ਨਬਜ਼ ਆਮ ਹੈ, ਆਕਸੀਜਨ ਸੰਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਾ 94% 'ਤੇ ਆਮ ਹੈ। ਗਲਾਸਗੋ 15, ਬਾਰ। ਤੁਸੀਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਹੱਥਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਪੈਰਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਚੌਥੀ ਡਿਗਰੀ ਦੀ ਗਤੀਸ਼ੀਲਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਸੁਰੱਖਿਅਤ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਤੁਰ ਸਕਦੇ ਹੋ, ਪਰ ਸੁਤੰਤਰ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਨਹੀਂ।

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: ਕੀ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਮਿਲਣਾ ਚਾਹੁੰਦੇ ਹੋ ਜਾਂ ਜਾਰੀ ਰੱਖਣਾ ਚਾਹੁੰਦੇ ਹੋ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਆਪਣੇ ਭਰਾ ਦੇ ਇਲਾਜ ਲਈ ਜਾਣਾ ਪਵੇਗਾ: 03/15 ਦੇ ਮੌਸਮ ਦੇ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ ਲਈ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਸਰਜਰੀ ਅਤੇ 03/25 ਦੇ ਗੱਲਬਾਤ ਇਲਾਜ ਲਈ... ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਫਿਜ਼ੀਓਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਸਮਾਂ-ਸਾਰਣੀ ਬਣਾਉਣੀ ਪਵੇਗੀ।

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: Do I need to be taken to the hospital?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਐਮਰਜੈਂਸੀ ਕੇਅਰ ਯੂਨਿਟ' ਵਿੱਚ ਭੇਜਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਤੁਸੀਂ 3 ਦਿਨ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ 'ਅਚਾਨਕ ਡਿੱਗ ਪਏ' ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਤੇਜ਼ ਬੁਖਾਰ ਅਤੇ ਦਰਦ ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਤੇਜ਼ ਬੁਖਾਰ (38.3 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਸੈਲਸੀਅਸ) ਅਤੇ ਖੁਸ਼ਕ ਖੰਘ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਸੀਂ 'ਕੋਨਿਗ ਸਿੰਡਰੋਮ' ਬਾਰੇ ਗੱਲ ਕਰ ਰਹੇ ਹੋ?
answer: Beautiful women are described as "rosy" and "with hair, perhaps bilaterally papillaceous neoplasm (cancer)".

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਸੀਂ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦੇ ਹੋ? (ਉਸਦੀ ਆਵਾਜ਼ ਪਰੇਸ਼ਾਨ ਜਾਪਦੀ ਸੀ)
answer: ਨਾ ਇਨਸਾਨੀਅਤ ਦਾ ਕੋਈ ਅਹਿਸਾਸ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਨਾ ਹੀ ਸ਼ਿਸ਼ਟਾਚਾਰ ਦਾ। ਉਸ ਸੱਜਣ ਨੇ ਗੁੱਸਾ ਖਾ ਲਿਆ ਅਤੇ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਬਾਰੇ ਬੁਰਾ ਬੋਲਿਆ।

answer: ਸੁੰਦਰ ਦੀ ਸ਼ਿਕਾਇਤ ਸੀ ਕਿ ਉਸ ਦਾ ਆਰ.ਟੀ.-ਪੀ.ਸੀ.ਆਰ. ਟੈਸਟ 2016/21 ਵਿੱਚ ਨੈਗੇਟਿਵ ਆਇਆ ਸੀ, ਜਿਸ ਨੂੰ ਜਾਂਚ ਅਧਿਕਾਰੀ ਨੇ ਅਣਗੌਲਿਆ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਸੀ।

answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ ਕਿਹਾ ਕਿ ਤੁਸੀਂ 15 ਦਿਨਾਂ ਤੋਂ ਨਹੀਂ ਸੁੱਤੇ। ਇਸ ਲਈ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਕੀਮੋਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਦੇ ਚੱਕਰ ਰੁਕ ਗਏ ਹਨ।

question: ਕੀ ਮੈਨੂੰ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਕਲੀਫ਼ ਹੋ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਬਚਾਅ ਦੌਰਾਨ, ਉਹ ਇੱਕ ਭੰਡਾਰ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਾਸਕ ਪਹਿਨੇ ਅਤੇ 10 ਲੀਟਰ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਮਿੰਟ ਦੀ ਦਰ ਨਾਲ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਂਦਾ ਹੋਇਆ ਮਿਲਿਆ। ਉਸਦੇ ਟੈਸਟਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ 'ਸੁੱਕੇ ਫੇਫੜੇ ਅਤੇ ਘੱਟ ਸਾਹ ਦੀ ਦਰ' ਦਿਖਾਈ ਦਿੱਤੀ। ਸੰਖੇਪ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਜ਼ਿਕਰ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਉਸਨੂੰ 'ਨਮੂਨੀਆ' ਹੈ।

question: ਕੀ ਉਹ ਮੇਰਾ ਮਨ ਲੱਭ ਰਿਹਾ ਸੀ?
answer: ਪੂਰੀ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਇਹ ਸਿੱਟਾ ਕੱਢਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਉਸ ਦੀ ਮੌਤ ਦਾ ਕਾਰਨ "ਨੱਕ ਦੇ ਸਾਈਨਸ ਅਤੇ ਕਾਰਟੀਲੇਜ ਦਾ ਅੰਸ਼ਕ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ" ਅਤੇ "ਡੋਰਸਲ ਵੈਂਟ੍ਰੀਕੂਲਰ ਫੈਟ ਦਾ ਅੰਸ਼ਕ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ" ਸੀ।

discharge_summary: admission: 05/29/2020, discharge: 06/25/2020, stay: 26 d 11 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 43 years old, [postal code] regular general condition: [registration number] height: 167 cm weight: 85 kg problem: severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus onset of symptoms 05/17: fever runny nose worsening of symptoms 05/28: dyspnea rt pcr positive on 05/29 orotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation initiated: 05/29 external proning: first proning: 06/04 at 12:30 h, supine 06/05 at 11:15 h, evolution: bilateral pneumothorax, extensive subcutaneous emphysema to the face. {omitted}, bilateral drain in outpatient setting poorly functioning 05/30: drained by [organization] well positioned and functioning [person] 05/31 06/01: left drained 06/04: poor p/f ratio, {omitted} 06/05: subcutaneous emphysema worsening, x-ray with pneumothorax redone. reevaluation by surgery requested 06/06: right chest tube removed, left chest tube kept on continuous suction 06/07: subcutaneous emphysema improved 06/08: head and neck surgery approval requested for bronchoscopy 06/10: orthodontic appliance removed by dentistry, authorized by family 06/10: tracheostomy performed with pus discharge upon insertion into the skin. 06/11: control chest tomography showing: complicated hydropneumothorax on the left pneumomediastinum mediastinitis? question: Am I going to the hospital?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਤੀਬਰ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਕਲੀਫ਼ ਹੋ ਰਹੀ ਸੀ। 28 ਮਈ ਨੂੰ, ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਲੱਛਣ "ਸਦਮੇ ਦੀ ਹਾਲਤ" ਵਿੱਚ ਵਿਗੜ ਗਏ, ਅਤੇ 29 ਮਈ ਨੂੰ, ਤੁਹਾਡੇ "ਆਰਟੀ-ਪੀਸੀਆਰ" (ਕੋਵਿਡ ਟੈਸਟ) ਦਾ ਨਤੀਜਾ ਸਕਾਰਾਤਮਕ ਆਇਆ।

question: ਮਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਵੈਂਟੀਲੇਟਰ 'ਤੇ ਕਿਉਂ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ?
answer: 29 ਮਈ ਨੂੰ, ਜਦੋਂ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਕੋਵਿਡ-19 ਟੈਸਟ ਦਾ ਨਤੀਜਾ ਪਾਜ਼ੇਟਿਵ ਆਇਆ, ਤਾਂ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਏਅਰਵੇ ਇੰਟਿਊਬੇਸ਼ਨ ਐਂਡ ਮਕੈਨੀਕਲ ਵੈਂਟੀਲੇਸ਼ਨ' ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਾਖਲ ਕਰਵਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਅਤੇ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 'ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ' ਆਈ।

question: ਮੈਨੂੰ ਖੰਘ ਆਈ। ਇਸ ਨੂੰ 'ਉਗਸ' ਕਿਹਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਸੀ।
answer: 6 ਅਪ੍ਰੈਲ 2010 ਨੂੰ, ਮਰੀਜ਼ ਦੀ ਜਾਂਚ ਕਰਨ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਉਸਦੀ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਿਹਾ ਗਿਆ ਕਿ "ਨਿਊਮੋਥੋਰੈਕਸ ਅਤੇ ਐਂਪੀਏਮਾ ਦੋਵੇਂ ਹੀ ਬਹੁਤ ਜ਼ਿਆਦਾ ਸਨ।" ਇਸਦਾ ਮਤਲਬ ਸੀ ਕਿ ਦੋਵੇਂ ਫੇਫੜੇ ਢਹਿ ਗਏ ਸਨ, ਅਤੇ ਛਾਤੀ ਵਿੱਚ ਹਵਾ ਜਮ੍ਹਾਂ ਹੋ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਮੇਰੀ ਟੇਪ ਨੂੰ ਸੰਪਾਦਿਤ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ?
answer: ਅੰਦਰ 'ਖੋਰ ਨਿਮੋਥਰੇਕਸ' (ਖੋਰ ਨਿਮਬੰਧ ਕੁਦਾਕੇ) ਸੀ। ਨਾਲ ਹੀ 'ਖੋਰ ਉੱਚਾ ਨਾਲੀ' (ਖੋਰ ਨਾਲੀ) ਵੀ ਜੋੜ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ। 2073/2074 ਵਿੱਚ 'ਯੇਤਾ ਨਾਲੀ' ਹਟਾ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ। ਖੋਰ ਨਾਲੀ ਉਹੀ ਰਹੀ।

question: ਮੇਰੀ ਨੱਕ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਕਿੰਨਾ ਖ਼ੂਨ ਵਗ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ?
answer: 11 ਨਵੰਬਰ, 2019 ਨੂੰ, ਇੱਕ ਸੀਟੀ ਸਕੈਨ ਨੇ ਮਰੀਜ਼ ਵਿੱਚ ਪਲਮਨਰੀ ਥ੍ਰੋਮੋਐਂਬੋਲਿਜ਼ਮ ਦੀ 25% ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਦਿਖਾਈ।

question: ਕੀ ਮੇਰੇ ਮੂੰਹ ਵਿੱਚੋਂ ਖੂਨ ਨਿਕਲ ਰਿਹਾ ਸੀ?
answer: ਹਾਲਾਂਕਿ, ਉਸ ਨੇ ਉਸ ਆਦਮੀ ਨੂੰ "ਨਿਰਦਈ" ਅਤੇ "ਖੂਨ-ਖਰਾਬੇ ਤੋਂ ਬਚਣ ਲਈ ਹਰ ਸੰਭਵ ਤਰੀਕੇ ਨਾਲ ਕੱਪੜੇ ਪਹਿਨੇ" ਵਜੋਂ ਦਰਸਾਇਆ।

question: ਸਾਡੀ ਅਨਾਜ ਦੀ ਸਪਲਾਈ ਕਿਉਂ ਘੱਟ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੀ ਕਿਡਨੀ ਨੇ 18 ਜੂਨ ਨੂੰ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਨਾ ਬੰਦ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤਾ (ਸਟੇਜ III)। 20 ਜੂਨ ਨੂੰ ਇਹ ਫਿਰ ਸੁਧਰ ਗਈ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਹੀਮੋਡਾਇਲਸਿਸ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ।

question: ਅਸੀਂ ਉਹ ਦਵਾਈਆਂ (ਨਕਸੋਪੇਹਰੀਨ) ਕਿਉਂ ਨਹੀਂ ਰੋਕਦੇ ਜੋ ਖੂਨ ਦਾ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ ਕਰਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ?
answer: He was admitted to the hospital on June 20 for evaluation of a kidney failure and was diagnosed on June 14 with a thrombosed embolism, a clot in the arteries that caused an infarction.

discharge_summary: 1. coronavirus infection onset of symptoms 02/17 orotracheal intubation 02/24 extubation 03/08 2. septic shock from pulmonary focus requiring vasoactive drug resolved: antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 02/23 03/02 clarithromycin 04/24 03/02 corticosteroid therapy: 02/24 03/09 3. critically ill polyneuropathy grade 2 strength upper limbs and lower limbs 4. pressure injury left lower limb grade i 5. your appointment scheduled with gynecology. on 03/24 for investigation. admission: 02/24/2020, discharge: 03/19/2020, stay: 22 d 21 h, location: ward, payer: sus. current: [person] with severe acute respiratory syndrome due to coronavirus, onset of symptoms on 02/17, requiring orotracheal intubation due to respiratory failure on 02/24, due to the possibility of associated bacterial pneumonia, antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone and clarithromycin was performed. [person] presented satisfactory clinical evolution, and extubation was performed on 03/08, without complications. Gradual weaning of oxygen therapy was performed, and oxygen was withdrawn on 03/17, at the time comfortable in room air. Due to prolonged use of neuromuscular blocker to manage mechanical ventilation, [person] developed critically ill polyneuropathy, currently with grade II motor strength in the upper and lower limbs. He also has a pressure injury in the left lower limb, which is improving, with no signs of infection. Insulin therapy was started to manage hyperglycemia, with weaning after optimization of oral metformin. It is worth mentioning that during hospitalization [person] presented abnormal vaginal bleeding, and an appointment with gynecology was scheduled for 03/24 for investigation. Good general condition, hydrated, normal color, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile; respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds with crackles on a residual basis, without respiratory distress; cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in two beats; normal sound sounds without murmurs; abdomen: innocent; extremities without edema, free calves, capillary refill time less than 3 s, ulcer on the left lower limb, grade I. therapeutic plan: I speak with [person] about the importance of performing pulmonary and motor physiotherapy to manage polyneuropathy in critically ill patients. He states that he will pay for home physiotherapy. He is referred to a basic health unit: management of hypertension and diabetes. Dressing of ulcer in the left lower limb region. I prescribe a dressing with AGE. Guidance from the nutrition team regarding the home diet. I follow-up appointment to the GEAD outpatient clinic on 04/26 for clinical reassessment. I follow-up appointment to the speech therapy outpatient clinic on 05/05. I schedule a pelvic ultrasound for 03/22 and a surgical gynecology outpatient clinic for 03/24. I investigate uterine bleeding. against reference [organization]. Good general condition, maintaining polyneuropathy in critically ill patients, with improvement in motor strength grade II.
question: Am I going to the hospital?
answer: ਉਸ ਨੂੰ 24 ਫਰਵਰੀ 2020 ਨੂੰ ਕੋਰੋਨਾਵਾਇਰਸ ਤੋਂ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣ ਦੇ ਸਿੰਡਰੋਮ ਕਾਰਨ ਹਸਪਤਾਲ ਵਿੱਚ ਦਾਖਲ ਕਰਵਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਉਸ ਨੂੰ ਇੰਟੂਬੇਟ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਐਨਾਮੋਕਸ ਵਰਗੀਆਂ ਐਂਟੀਬਾਇਓਟਿਕਸ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ?
answer: ਬੈਕਟੀਰੀਆ ਦੇ ਨਮੂਨੀਆ ਲਈ ਸਿਫਾਰਸ਼ ਕੀਤੀ ਐਂਟੀਬਾਇਓਟਿਕ ਇਲਾਜ ਸੇਫਟ੍ਰਾਈਐਕਸੋਨ ਅਤੇ ਕਲੈਰੀਥਰੋਮਾਈਸਿਨ ਹੈ।

question: ਮੇਰੇ ਹੱਥ ਅਤੇ ਪੈਰ ਇੰਨੇ ਕਮਜ਼ੋਰ ਕਿਉਂ ਹਨ?
answer: ਨਿਊਰੋਹਾਰਮੋਨਲ ਡਿਪ੍ਰੈਸੈਂਟਸ ਦੀ ਲੰਬੇ ਸਮੇਂ ਤੱਕ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਉਸਨੂੰ ਗੰਭੀਰ, ਦੇਰ ਨਾਲ ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਹੋਣ ਵਾਲਾ, ਨਾ ਬਦਲਣਯੋਗ ਕੋਮਾ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ ਜਿਸ ਨਾਲ ਉਸਦੇ ਉੱਪਰਲੇ ਅਤੇ ਹੇਠਲੇ ਅੰਗ ਪ੍ਰਭਾਵਿਤ ਹੋਏ।

question: ਜਦੋਂ ਮੈਂ ਬੁੱਢਾ ਹੋ ਜਾਵਾਂਗਾ, ਮੈਂ ਕੀ ਕਰਾਂਗਾ?
answer: ਉਹ ਸੁਝਾਅ ਦਿੰਦੇ ਹਨ ਕਿ ਦਰਦ ਵਾਲੇ ਮਰੀਜ਼ਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਪੌਲੀਯੂਰੇਥੈਰੇਪੀ, ਫਾਸਫੋਰਸ ਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਅਤੇ ਮੋਟਰ ਫਿਜ਼ੀਓਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਦੀ ਪੇਸ਼ਕਸ਼ ਕੀਤੀ ਜਾਣੀ ਚਾਹੀਦੀ ਹੈ।

question: ਮਰੀਜ਼ ਨੂੰ ਵਾਧੂ ਆਕਸੀਜਨ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਕਿਉਂ ਹੈ?
answer: "ਨਹੀਂ, ਆਕਸੀਜਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਵਾਧਾ ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ, 17/03 ਨੂੰ ਆਕਸੀਜਨ ਵਧੀ ਸੀ, ਉਸ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ ਹੌਲੀ-ਹੌਲੀ ਸਾਹ ਲੈਣਾ ਆਸਾਨ ਹੋ ਗਿਆ।"

question: ਸਾਡੇ 'ਅਸਧਾਰਨ ਖੂਨ' ਦੇ ਨੁਕਸਾਨ ਦਾ ਕਾਰਨ ਕੀ ਹੈ?
answer: Specifically, "[the uterus] was abnormally dilated. You were admitted for gynecological problems... [the examination] was scheduled for March 24, 2021," and "The uterus pregnancy check will be done by pelvic ultrasound on March 22, 2021."

question: ਮੇਰਾ ਸੱਜਾ ਹੱਥ ਕਿੰਨਾ ਜ਼ਖਮੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਹੇਠਲੇ ਖੱਬੇ ਪਾਸੇ 'ਅੰਦਰੂਨੀ ਪੇਟ ਦਾ ਦਬਾਅ' ਗ੍ਰੇਡ 1 ਹੈ, ਜੋ ਕਿ ਹੇਠਲੇ ਸੱਜੇ ਪਾਸੇ 'ਪੇਟ ਦੀ ਕਮਰ, ਗ੍ਰੇਡ 1' ਹੈ। ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਪਹਿਲੇ ਦੇਖਭਾਲ ਪ੍ਰਦਾਤਾ ਨੇ ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਪਹਿਲੀ ਦੇਖਭਾਲ ਯੂਨਿਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਹੇਠਲੇ ਸੱਜੇ ਪਾਸੇ 'ਪੇਟ ਦੀ ਕਮਰ ਦੇ ਡਰੈਸਰ' ਦਿੱਤੇ ਹਨ।

question: ਕੀ ਇਨਸੁਲਿਨ ਸੱਚਮੁੱਚ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਹੈ?
answer: ਇਨਸੁਲਿਨ ਥੈਰੇਪੀ ਨੇ ਹਾਈਪਰਗਲਾਈਸੀਮੀਆ ਨੂੰ ਕਾਬੂ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਰ ਲਿਆ। 'ਮੁਖ-ਸੇ-ਮੁਖ' ਮੈਟਫੋਰਮਿਨ ਬੰਦ ਕਰ ਦਿੱਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ।

question: ਕੀ ਉਸ ਨੂੰ ਅਜੇ ਵੀ ਵੈਂਟੀਲੇਟਰ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ?
answer: ਨਹੀਂ। ਉਹ 2010/11 ਵਿੱਚ ਆਪਣੇ ਕਮਰੇ ਦੇ ਬਾਹਰ ਆਮ ਵਾਂਗ ਵਿਵਹਾਰ ਕਰ ਰਿਹਾ ਸੀ, ਅਤੇ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਚੁੱਕਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੋਈ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਨਹੀਂ ਆਈ। ਜਦੋਂ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਲਿਜਾਇਆ ਗਿਆ ਤਾਂ ਉਹ ਠੀਕ ਸੀ, ਨਹੀਂ ਤਾਂ ਕੋਈ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਨਹੀਂ ਸੀ।

discharge_summary: abdominal septic shock, bloodstream septic shock. admission: 03/15/2020, discharge: 03/29/2020, stay: 14 days 02 hours, location: ward: payer: sus. 1 septic shock abdominal focus decline in general condition diarrhea decreased level of consciousness onset of symptoms 03/14 orotracheal intubation on admission 03/15 due to decreased level of consciousness antibiotic therapy: meropenem din 03/15 2 atrial fibrillation [person] with irregular rhythm on admission despite no record of the comorbidity in the medical record, {person} of [person] confirms previous diagnosis of atrial fibrillation, electrocardiogram admission 03/15: atrial fibrillation 3 septic shock bloodstream 03/22: worsening of hemodynamics worsening of parameters in blood culture tests 03/22/2020: klebsiella pneumoniae. presenting complaint: decreased level of consciousness, respiratory failure, diarrhea, chest pain, history collected from [person], [person] and [person]: [person] observed a decreased level of consciousness this morning, with [person] aphasic, and presenting worsening of the basal hemiplegia. She evolved with respiratory distress, and the [organization] was called to provide assistance. at the scene, the [organization] team found blood pressure of 60x0 mmhg, non-measurable oxygen saturation, capillary refill time greater than 3 s, poorly perfused extremities, glasgow 6. 1000 ml of ringer's lactate and 500 ml of sf 0.9% were infused during transport and oxygen was administered 10 l/min via mask with reservoir. Norepinephrine 20 ml/h was started while still in the ambulance shortly before being admitted to the {organization}. [person] reports that [person] has had a progressive decline in her general health and diarrhea since yesterday, with 4 voluminous, watery bowel movements, without blood or pus, after 5 days of constipation. [person] also reports that [person] complained of chest pain this morning, but was unable to detail the characteristics of the pain. They deny fever, abdominal pain, dyspnea, cough, dysuria, nausea, vomiting, or other symptoms. [person] was admitted to the lower emergency unit, glasgow 9 3 1 5, with evident respiratory distress, pulse oxygen saturation not measurable, poorly perfused, capillary refill time greater than 3 s. Orotracheal intubation was performed on admission, {omitted}. Sedation with fentanyl and midazolam was initiated. Norepinephrine was maintained at 25 ml/h 0.382 mcg/kg/min. personal history: 1 systemic arterial hypertension 2 epilepsy in AEPA follow-up 3 nucleocapsular hemorrhagic stroke ich1 / sich1 on 07/01 etiology: hypertensive, clinical: right hemiparesis, deviation of the labial rhyme to the left, confusion nihss admission 17 1b.2 / 4.2 / 5d.3 / 5e.1 / 6d.3 / 6e.2 / 8.1 / 9.1 / 10.2 previous rankin: 0 computed tomography of the skull admission: intraparenchymal thalamocapsular hemorrhage 7.7 ml CT Angiography (CTA): no stenosis or significant vascular changes identified during previous hospitalization 07/01, left hemothorax with atelectasis due to fractures of the ribs t6t11 trauma prior to hospitalization resolved with thoracic drainage fracture of the left transverse process of t7 and fractures due to demineralization from t6t11 continuous use medications: enalapril 10 mg 12/12h amlodipine 10 mg hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg carbamazepine 700 mg/day phenobarbital 100 mg/day propranolol 40 mg [person] brought, but does not know how to inform the dose, laboratory tests: 03/16 hb 12.5 ht 38 leuco 22,000 plt 282,000 na 129 k 4.6 ca 1.04 cr 1.4 lact 3.7 urine routine nitrite leuco 20,000 red blood cells 3540 granular casts 03/18: hb 11.2 ht 34 leuco 15300 plt 150000 na 134 k 3.3 cr 0.88 ur 82 lactate 2.4 pcr 23.75 ldh 821 cultures: blood culture 03/15: no growth. urine culture 03/15: no growth. tracheal aspirate 03/16: no growth. blood culture 03/22: klebsiella pneumoniae. antibiotics on admission meropenem 03/15 03/16 ceftriaxone metronidazole 03/16 03/21 meropenam vancomycin 03/22 03/27 ceftazidime avibactam 03/28 03/29 imaging tests: transthoracic echocardiogram 03/17: moderate dilation of the left atrium and mild dilation of the left atrium and ventricle. markedly depressed systolic performance of the ventricles. alterations in segmental mobility of the left ventricle. moderate mitral valve insufficiency. mild pulmonary valve insufficiency. in time, late in the afternoon, I am called to evaluate [person] in a semi-intensive bed. I find [person] monitored with orotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation with the following vital signs on the monitor: heart rate: 0 beats per minute, no electrical activity identified by the monitor and no invasive blood pressure curve on the monitor. no signal also on pulse oximetry. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I perform a physical examination with absent central pulses. I proceed with a physical examination of the trunk reflex with absence of oculocephalic reflexes, absence of corneal-palpal reflex and fixed medium pupils that do not react to light, without consensual reflex. I certify death at {omitted}. surgical tracheostomy 03/27. death.
question: What, I went to the hospital?
answer: ਉਹ 'ਸਦਮੇ' ਵਿੱਚ ਸੀ, 'ਅਧਰੰਗ', 'ਬੇਹੋਸ਼ੀ' ਅਤੇ 'ਦੌਰੇ' ਤੋਂ ਪੀੜਤ ਸੀ। ਟਰਾਂਸਪੋਰਟ ਟੀਮ ਨੇ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਬਚਾਇਆ ਕਿਉਂਕਿ ਉਸਦਾ ਬਲੱਡ ਪ੍ਰੈਸ਼ਰ ਗਲਾਸਗੋ 6 ਤੋਂ 60x00 mmHg ਸੀ, ਅਤੇ ਉਸਦੇ ਹੱਥ ਅਤੇ ਪੈਰ ਸੁੰਨ ਸਨ।

question: Why does septic happen?
answer: ਉਸਨੂੰ "ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਐਬਡੋਮੀਨਲ ਫੋਕਸ" ਅਤੇ "ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਹੇਮੇਟੋਸਿਸ" ਹੋਣ ਦਾ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗਾ। ਉਸਦੇ ਲੱਛਣਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ "ਆਮ ਕਮਜ਼ੋਰੀ, ਦਸਤ, ਅਤੇ ਘੱਟ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਚੀਅਨ" ਅਤੇ "ਹੀਮੋਡਾਇਨਾਮਿਕ ਅਸਥਿਰਤਾ" (ਲਾਲ ਧਾਰੀਆਂ) ਸ਼ਾਮਲ ਸਨ, ਇਸ ਲਈ ਉਸਨੂੰ "ਨੋਰੇਡਰੇਨਾਲੀਨ" (ਇੱਕ ਦਵਾਈ ਜੋ ਲਾਲੀ ਨੂੰ ਵਧਾਉਂਦੀ ਹੈ) ਲੈਣੀ ਪਈ।

question: ਕੀ ਮੇਰਾ ਭਰਾ ਬੀਮਾਰ ਹੈ?
answer: ਉਸਨੂੰ 'ਕਲੱਬਬਿਲ ਨਮੂਨੀਆ' ਅਤੇ 'ਕਲਚਰ 03/22' ਨਾਲ ਸਹੀ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਨਿਦਾਨ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਇਸ ਨਾਲ 'ਸੈਪਟਿਕ ਸਦਮਾ ਖੂਨ ਵਹਿਣਾ' ਅਤੇ 'ਹੇਮਾਟੋਡਾਇਨਾਮਿਕ ਅਸਥਿਰਤਾ' ਹੋਈ।

question: ਦਿਲ ਦਾ ਕੰਮ (ਈਕੋਕਾਰਡੀਓਗ੍ਰਾਮ) ਕਿਵੇਂ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ?
answer: Transesophageal echocardiogram (TCE) reveals "significantly reduced systolic echocardiogram heart area", "partial segmental Doppler velocity" and "mild mitral valve insufficiency".

question: ਓਏ, ਤੇਰੇ ਕੰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੁਝ ਫਸਿਆ ਹੋਇਆ ਹੈ, ਵੀਰੇ?
answer: ਤੁਸੀਂ 'ਅਸਧਾਰਨ ਦਿਲ ਦੀ ਧੜਕਣ' ਦੇ ਅਧਿਐਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਹਿੱਸਾ ਲਿਆ। 'ਇਲੈਕਟ੍ਰੋਕਾਰਡੀਓਗ੍ਰਾਮ ਐਂਟਰੀ 03/15' ਨੇ ਕੋਈ 'ਐਟਰੀਅਲ ਫਾਈਬ੍ਰਿਲੇਸ਼ਨ' ਨਹੀਂ ਲੱਭੀ, ਜਿਸਨੂੰ ਤੁਹਾਡੇ ਪਰਿਵਾਰਕ ਮੈਂਬਰਾਂ ਨੇ ਲੱਭਿਆ ਅਤੇ 'ਪਹਿਲਾਂ ਤੋਂ ਮੌਜੂਦ ਸਥਿਤੀ' ਹੋਣ ਦੀ ਪੁਸ਼ਟੀ ਕੀਤੀ।

question: ਮੇਰਾ ਪਿਤਾ ਕੌਣ ਹੈ?
answer: ਛੋਟੀ ਰਿਪੋਰਟ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਿਹਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ, "ਉਮਰ ਨਾਲ ਸਬੰਧਤ ਸਿਹਤ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਦੇ ਕੁਦਰਤੀ ਕਾਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਪਛਾਣ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਕੋਈ ਹੋਰ ਜੋਖਮ ਕਾਰਕ ਨਹੀਂ ਸੀ ਅਤੇ ਉਸਨੂੰ ਦਿਲ ਦਾ ਦੌਰਾ ਪਿਆ ਅਤੇ ਸਟ੍ਰੋਕ ਹੋਇਆ।"

question: "ਸਰਜੀਕਲ ਟ੍ਰੈਕਿਓਸਟੋਮੀ" (ਪਿੱਠ ਦੇ ਹੇਠਲੇ ਹਿੱਸੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਇੱਕ ਖੁੱਲ੍ਹਣਾ) ਦਾ ਕੀ ਕਾਰਨ ਸੀ?
answer: ਆਖਰੀ ਵਾਕ ਵਿੱਚ, "the word that was shouted" ਨੂੰ "the word that was shouted" (the word that was shouted) ਹੋਣਾ ਚਾਹੀਦਾ ਹੈ। 27/03 ਨੂੰ "surgical tracheostomy" ਦਾ ਜ਼ਿਕਰ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ। ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ 15/03 ਨੂੰ intubated ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।
